radiographic_examinations.findings: Lung bases are clear. There is no pleural or pericardial effusion. A tubular structure in the right lower quadrant measuring 11 mm likely reflects an abnormal inflamed appendix with thickened edematous walls and courses into an ill-defined heterogeneous area in the right lower quadrant measuring 5.1 x 3.3 cm concerning for phlegmon. Small amount of mildly complex free fluid surrounds the large phlegmonous region in the right pelvis. No blastic or lytic lesion concerning for malignancy.
